title: Linear Equations Practice Exam
description: Test your understanding of solving linear equations, including one-step, multi-step, and word problems.

questions.question: Solve the equation: $x + 12 = 27$. What is the value of $x$? (Enter just the number)
Solve the equation: $3x + 5 = 20$
questions.explanation: First subtract 5 from both sides: $3x = 15$. Then divide by 3: $x = 5$.

questions.question: When solving the equation $x - 7 = 10$, you should subtract 7 from both sides.
questions.explanation: You should ADD 7 to both sides to isolate $x$. This gives $x = 17$. Remember to use the inverse operation.

questions.question: Solve: $5a - 8 = 2a + 7$. What is the value of $a$? (Enter just the number)
questions.explanation: Subtract $2a$ from both sides: $3a - 8 = 7$. Add 8 to both sides: $3a = 15$. Divide by 3: $a = 5$.

questions.question: What property of equality states that if $a = b$, then $a + c = b + c$?
questions.explanation: This is the Addition Property of Equality. It states that adding the same number to both sides of an equation maintains equality.

questions.question: Solve using the distributive property: $3(x - 2) = 21$
questions.explanation: Distribute: $3x - 6 = 21$. Add 6 to both sides: $3x = 27$. Divide by 3: $x = 9$.

questions.question: Jason has 45 baseball cards. He gives away some cards and has 28 left. Write an equation to find how many cards he gave away (use $c$ for cards given away).
questions.explanation: Starting with 45 cards and giving away $c$ cards leaves 28 cards: $45 - c = 28$. (Solving this equation gives $c = 17$ cards given away.)
